intro: Phyllanthus moluccanus, commonly known as the Java date tree or false date palm, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by birds and other animals. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in various parts of the world.
